Continuation: We left and get back home. The following day my husband and I went for morning glory at church. Our theme was "every altor against my life catch fire". We were pushing in prayers and I felt dizzy and couldn't pray anymore. Indeed there was fire everywhere. After prayers I went and see my pastor, instead of telling him what I encountered, he is the one who narrated everything to me. He told me go home and decide on a name that I would give the child in my womb and pray commanding him to live. He told me that I wasn't going to miscarry but will have that baby to show the goodness of the Lord. Days came so as months, the ninth month came and there were no signs of labour. We prayed and asked God to intervene. Two weeks later I went a see my gynae and insisted that I be induced for labour. On the 6th of march I was induced for labour and delivered a bouncing baby boy, the one whom I was told that he never existed and also after I was told that am not going to conceive again. I am an Omega Child, the Child Of fire. I named the Boy SHILOH (GOD SENT) the name I dreamt of when the pregnancy was a month old and also which was prophecied about when I was in the sixth by my pastor. Surely I will sing in my rapture Glory to God for such a Redeemer as mine.

A wonderful Saviour is Jesus Christ indeed. He hideth my life in the depths of His love and covers me there with His love. This became my song when I was told that at the age of 24, I wasn't going to conceive again because there was water in my pelvis. Can you imagine how it got there? The devil is a liar. I went to see my pastor (Pastor Paul Adogamhe) and told him what I've encountered, he asked me a simple question: "whose report do you believe, is it God's or man's report?" I was challenged and it made me to focus on the Lord who is Jesus Christ. He prayed for me and after a month I missed my period and decided to have a pregnant test. It was confirmed that I was pregnant, I was overjoyed and I knew that the dry and thirsty land have been overshadowed. Three months down the line my inlaws visited me and decided to visit a white garment prophet. I told them to go and see my pastor but they refused and insisted that I should go with them to a white garment prophet. When we got there he said to me, "Madam you feel nauseous like a pregnant woman, there is nothing in your womb, I want to give you holy water so that you will clean your womb after that you will conceive..."

This morning while I was on my way to office I sang this song all the way. It is a song of consolation, confidence and assurance as believers. Christ is a wonderful Savior in all ramifications. I will ever live to sing this timely song till I see Him face to face. Thanks a million to Fanny Jane Crosby, A woman of faith.

Simple yet profound, with a melody that matches the words beautifully. My soul is touched and refreshed. I'm reminded that I have a safe place, a place of peace and joy, in the cleft of the rock. I can pray with the psalmist 'lead me to the rock that is higher than I' [Psalm 61]. I feel God's peace and presence soothe away my anxieties. I'm reminded again that God loves me, yes me! I know that not only does God offer salvation and protection, He offers joy, pleasure, peace and security. Thank You my precious Jesus, my wonderful Saviour, for all the good things You have done, are doing and wil do for us. Amen.
Simply no words; a groaning which yearns for the Saviour.
God almighty, You are wonderful. Every time during the end of the year, someone I love hurt me so badly, but Lord, You are there, You've been so good to me, really You are the wonderful Saviour.

I am deeply and prayerfully touched by this hymn! [The cleft of the rock signifies the cross. Christ was the cleft rock smitten for us (Exo. 17:6; 1 Cor. 10:4). Hence, the cleft of the rock signifies His crucifixion, and His crucifixion is just our cross. We must remain in the cleft of the rock; we must stay in His crucifixion. The Apostle Paul was always experiencing the death of Christ. He said, "I am crucified with Christ" (Gal. 2:20). He also shared that he was "always bearing about in the body the putting to death of Jesus,...For we which live are always delivered unto death for Jesus' sake...So then death worketh in us..." (2 Cor. 4:10-12). This is what it means to be the dove in the cleft of the rock. Only a long period of time in this experience can bring us to the next stage. (Life and Building as Portrayed in the Song of Songs, Chapter 5, Section 3)] O Lord Jesus, always keep me in 'the cleft of the rock,'! Amen! via http://www.ministrybooks.org/

Lord Jesus, What a wonderful Savior You are! In the cleft of the rock, there is a river of pleasure where we can enjoy and we find satisfaction in midst of dry and thirsty land! It is also so good to see how my brothers and sisters across the world have been blessed too.

Louise, what a beautiful story about seeing the cleft of a rock! I'm reading that story aloud to my little girl, who had asked me for an explanation of the imagery in this beautiful hymn. Thank you for sharing!
Great, great, wonderful song.

We just returned from a trip to the Grand Canyon, one of the 7 wonders of the world. Pictures cannot adequately describe the beauty of it. Only God could sculp something of such grandeur! As we were at a lookout point I noticed this large rock with a sharp angular jut, and immediatley knew that this must be what they call a "cleft". Immediately I thought of this hymn, and the promise that the Lord hides our soul in the cleft of the rock. Surrounded by miles of dry desert with no shade in sight, this cleft cast welcomed shade onto the structures beneath it. If it had not been deemed as being dangerous, I would have loved to have climbed over there and sat for a while! How great is our God!!

This song reminds me of my mother who passed away 2 years ago next month in July. Every time we sing it in church I get teary. I look forward to the day Jesus comes and pray we meet on that day. AMEN.

This is one of my favorite hymns, though I love them all because of the love Of God through Christ our Saviour! I get tears in my eyes every time I listen because God is so good to love me, who does not deserve it, but for His cleansing blood!!! Glory to GOD!!

This song is so meaningful to me. It ministered richly to me during one of the most difficult seasons of my life. Thanks for making it available here, music and all. May God continue to bless this wonderful ministry.

I have known this hymn since I was a small boy and with the years I find that this song speaks literally of my life's experience. Irrespective of where I have wandered in nearly 60 years since first meating Jesus I know my Saviour has me in the hollow of His hand.

I just love the second verse when it says "He taketh my burdens away". Each time I go through difficult times and I feel burdened by life's experiences I celebrate for through the second verse I know that it is time for God to take my burdens away.

Brings back childhood days of Mother singing gospel and teaching them to us so glad I learned them. What a beautiful song about God's goodness to us - love and blessing and all things good. Thank you.

20 years ago my husband left me. I spent sometime at home nearly 3000 miles away. I sat on the rocky beach one morning distressed and alone and from behind me I heard a rippling waterfall. I immediately thought of these words and at that moment my wonderful Saviour brought me out of my despair and heartache. I knew He would take care of me. The past 20 years have been very difficult at times, but I never forget this song. In these days I'm experiencing what most women go through and it has taken away my joy. I've again turned to this song and it gives me peace to know that my Wonderful Jesus is still as lovely and present as He ever was. And I give Him heartfelt thanks today.
This beautiful song touches so deeply my heart. Everyday that I hear it, my soul is refreshed. Oh precious Savior, come soon.

He hides us in the cleft of the rock even when we are not aware. Such a powerful song that I love so dearly, whenever I medidate on it I remember all the goodness my dear Saviour has shown to me over the years, and all I can say is 'Oh what a wonderful saviour I have'. May our faith always remain steadfast knowing that our wonderful Saviour is always watching over us.

This song came to mind for morning worship and I wanted to hear the music, so I used the web. What a great blessing to read all the comments about what a wonderful Savior we have. May God bless all of you, may He add to our faith. Yes, He has a plan and He is coming to take us home!
We grow up singing with this song. Being a pilipino working here at ksa we really miss regular Sunday services here and hymn singing.

Ohh what a Wonderful Saviour, since Pastor Skeete held a week of prayer at our church, and the theme song was this song, I saw souls touched and changed and so this so reminds me of the Amazing Love that Christ has for us. Please ponder upon this Great Love and may it Bless you.

Jesus is just a wonderful Saviour. I have experienced Him hold my hand when inside the darkest valley where even the dearest of friends has failed to reach. Brethren trust Jesus He is the only friend who can not disappoint you. God bless you. God bless the composers & those who made it available online that I can meditate anytime and anywhere.

This hymn has been a favorite of mine for many years, but it came to mind more vividly when I sat at the opening of a cave on a mountain near Jerusalem, and enjoyed its protection from the hot sun. I also recalled how the Lord spared me certain death by making me miss my scheduled flight on Kenya Airways that crashed in Cameroon on May 4, 2007. Yes He hides my soul in the cleft of the rock, He provides us protection and traces our way in life.

This song puts my soul to peace. It gives me assurance of the love of our Lord Jesus Christ, it reminds me how He cares for me ("He hideth my life in the depth of His love") Oh what a wonderful song! It tells me all! Love it.

Being away from my family and my local church and being plunged alone into an islamic country is very lonely and difficult. But I thank Jesus my Lord who has always with me all these years. He gives me joy and security despite of the highly insecured environment I am working with. Indeed, He is my Wonderful Savior. I cannot help but cry out of gratitude to the Lord Jesus Christ for saving me and loving me despite of who I am. Praise the Lord! I like the last stanza so much. What a hope we have in Jesus our Wonderful Savior!
oh how wonderful it is to know that Jesus is my savior, it gives me joy and assurance each time i sing this song for my hope is made perfect in him
I like this because the Lord has been so wonderful to me in all my ways.

I like the music of the song. I especially like the way the last and last but one lines of the chorus are sang. In addition this Song reminds me of that fact the Jesus bore a lot for me as a Saviour dying on the tree and is still much working for me, keeping evil away -hiding me in the rock.
The most wonderful is when this Jesus came in this earth to save us. Imagine that our Lord is also our Savior. So, I really love this song and I like to sing it. Amen amen amen!!!!!!!!!!!

I like this song simply because of it's intrinsic meaning of the Lord's love to me (us). I feel relieved and encouraged everytime I played this song. Being far from home (Philippines), and working in a Muslim dominated country, I can't help but miss my loved ones but this song gives me joy and comfort and reminds me how the Great One above takes care of me. Hallelujah!

I love this song because it brings great joy to my heart to think of how wonderful my Savior is! He loved me when I was so unloveable. I spent a long time out of fellowship with Christ and I was miserable. He brought me back and welcomed me with loving arms. My goal is to finish my life strong in my walk with the Savior who died for me and to tell the wonderful news of the gospel to everyone.

I love this song because I really think Jesus is a wonderful Saviour; He came to me when I was a poor, lost, lonely seven-year-old and He rescued me from a life not worth living, from standing on the edge of the harbour planning to jump in. He has always forgiven me for all my failings as a Christian. Having not been brought up in a Christian home made it difficult at times to fit in and be accepted by other Christians who have misunderstood my actions and behaviour from bad conditioning, but thank the Wonderful Saviour, He understands us at all times and can find out nothing about us that will put Him off us. I just cannot begin to tell you how wonderful it is to have known him for 43 years and He is more precious to me now than ever before.

I like John, being brought up in a Christian enviroment, was a brainwashed Christian for 28 years, and not knowing any better. Then the Lord said "Be still" by causing a problem with my feet. During this time I had felt the Holy Spirit convict me and lead me into the way and the plan the Lord had for my life. So I have a wonderful Saviour who waited and protected me for many years, until it was His time.

I discovered I had a large ovarian cyst which had to be removed immediately and was told after the surgery that it was cancerous. The surgery team concluded that I need a complete hysterectomy which I definitely did not want and found out later I did not need. I had been recruited from another state for the job in which I was currently working and had no family or friends to lean on for support or comfort. This song made me realize that I had a friend "who sticketh closer than a brother." The Lord came to my aid and made me know I was not alone.

The greatest achievement in my life is knowing Christ and His saving power. So when I sing this song my heart flows with tears of gratitude. For so long I used to depend on legalism till the Spirit made it clear to me that His grace is sufficient!! O what a wonderful Savior for He brought me out real mirry clay.

I like this song because Jesus IS a wonderful Savior! I had had a false profession for over 20 years. When after all that time I saw my life tailspinning out of control, the Lord convicted me that I was really lost all that time and drew me towards the Saviour. My biggest problem at the time was that after all the gospel preaching I'd heard over the years and never truly repented and turned towards Christ in faith, I thought maybe God would not accept me. My pastor told me that God would not convict someone He didn't want to save. That made sense and after a short time, I came to know the Lord for real.
So yes, Jesus IS a wonderful Savior! THANK YOU, LORD!!!
I like this song because of its fine lyrics. It touches the deepest part of my being. Praise the Lord.
